section.title: Share uploaded data
section.p: If you upload a spreadsheet, you can share Can View or Can Edit privileges with other people, who can further share them with others.

section.title: Understand data sharing
section.p: Data that you upload from a Web browser is only visible to you and to the administrator. You can share the entire uploaded table, or only some of its columns.

By default, if you share only some table columns, users with access to those columns cannot see the other columns' data in their searches. However, the data can become visible if a worksheet or pinboard that also contains those columns is shared with these users.
If you want to prevent other users from revealing your excluded columns, you can ask your administrator to enable a stricter behavior.
You can share data [from the Data tab]({{ site.baseurl }}#share-datatab), or [from within the table, worksheet, or view]({{ site.baseurl }}#share-dataset) that you want to share.

section.title: Share from the Data tab
section.p: To share uploaded data from the Data tab, follow these steps.

li.p: Click Data on the top navigation bar.
Hover over the uploaded data you want to share and select it by clicking the empty checkbox that appears.
Select Entire Table or Specific Columns.
If you select Specific Columns, select the column(s) you want to share. If you select Entire Table, skip to step 6.
Click + Add users or groups and select the users and groups with whom you want to share.

section.title: Share from within the dataset
section.p: To share data from within the dataset, follow these steps.

li.p: Navigate to the dataset you want to share.

Select the users or groups with whom you want to share. You can only share the entire table, worksheet, or view. You cannot share individual columns. To share individual columns, share [from the Data tab]({{site.baseurl }}#share-datatab).
Configure the level of access by selecting from the dropdown list. You can select:
Can View to provide read-only access. This enables viewing the table or other data source's data, as well as defining worksheets based on that data.
Can Edit to allow modification. This enables renaming, modifying, or deleting the entire table or other data source and adding or removing its columns.
The Share settings updated notification appears on the bottom of your screen.
